node.text:
• • • • •
We teased you yesterday, but no more monkeying around…here’s the recipe for Monkey Punch!

This tasty cocktail recipe has been created by Erik Lorincz from Kwānt, No.47 in The World’s 50 Best Bars 2019, with Monkey Shoulder whisky. Will you be giving it a try?

𝐈𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
25ml Monkey Shoulder
25ml Calvados
10ml Mezcal
10ml oloroso sherry
50ml oat milk
5g zatar
15g demerara sugar 
Garnished with floregano •
Video by @50bestbars
#tw50bc #theworlds50bestcocktails
#Worlds50BestBars #50BestBars #Cocktail #Bar #London #Recipe #CocktailRecipe #Bartender #UK #whisky @monkeyshoulder @kwantlondon @eriklorincz

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thecocktail.blog 

YELLOW JACKET RIFF
👨‍✈️
Originally having a base of Tequila, I saw it a perfect opportunity to take it in a wee different direction
👨‍✈️
It's no secret, that one of my favorite split endeavors is that of Gin & Mezcal - they compliment each other incredibly well in my book
👨‍✈️
Using another favorite template of mine, today's subtle, potent, sophisticated and fully enjoyable variation of the original, brought me much Joy
👨‍✈️
Would you;
👨‍✈️
GET MY JACKET PLEASE
👨‍✈️
30 ml Dry Gin (@illusionist_gin )
30 ml Mezcal 'Joven'
15 ml Elderflower Liqueur
10 ml Maraschino Amaro
2 Dashes Orange 🍊Bitters
Stir with Passion & Ice
Strain into chilled cocktail glass
Express lemon peel over the drink
Garnish fresh Eucalyptus leaf 🍃
Enjoy
Skål 🥂
⚜️
Find this, and many more, Classic and New Classics, on my website www.thecocktailblog.dk
⚜️

A TG Osteriában is elkezdődött a #NegroniWeek - mától egészen szeptember 19-ig! Négy izgalmas és különleges Negroni koktéllal készültünk Nektek: Americano Colpa, Superiore Negroni, Piemonte Negroni és Negrona. Alig várjuk, hogy megoszthassuk ezt a hetet minden egyes Negroni-rajongóval! 🥃
-
#NegroniWeek is back in TG Osteria, from today to Sunday, 19 Sept! This time we have four Negroni cocktails on offer, take your pick from: Americano Colpa, Superiore Negroni, Piemonte Negroni and Negrona. We can't wait to share this week with all of you Negroni lovers! 🥃

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @bar_pun 

• • • • • •
PUN 

🌴 Tropical “ Jungle Bird “ �
�
🕊 PUN uses simple syrup and cane sugar clusters for a better balance of its aroma and sweetness. Mixing it with Zacapa Rum 23 year, Campari and lime, we create a classic structured spirit with a bitter sweet balance.�
�
🍍 At last, Finalizing our Jungle Bird with filtered and clarified pineapple juice which gives a pure pineapple aroma without the disturbance of its fiber, echoing the tropical jungle touch of aged rum.�
�
�
�
🌴 熱帶 " Jungle Bird " �
�
🕊 用單糖糖水混和蔗糖塊，保有甜度帶出蔗香，混和 Zacapa23y Rum , Campari , Lime，做出經典烈酒苦甜酸的結構平衡。�
�
🍍 再加入除去纖維的澄清鳳梨汁，給予清澈鳳梨果香，與陳年蘭姆酒互相呼應出熱帶叢林樣貌。�
�
�
📍 內容物 ｜Ingredients �
Zacapa23y / Campari / Clarified Pineapple Juice / Simple Syrup / Sugar Cane�
�

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @cheerstohappyhour 

(Recipe Included) - 

Negroni Week has got me seeing all manner of bitter sippers from Chilean Negroni’s (as seen on @thehobbydrinkchef) to even a volcano Negroni I spotted on @camparicanada (compliments to @Giacomoloris_).
.
I wanted to create something inspired by the flavours of Japan. @nikkawhiskyusa gin, a little Umeshu and a touch of Umami is something that just needed to happen. In this glass is a lot of the classic flavours of the Negroni, but with noticeable plum up front and a salinity that makes every sip engulf your palate.
.
Drink: Umegroni
1 oz Nikka Coffey Gin
0.5 oz Sweet Vermouth
0.5 oz Choya Umeshu
1 oz Campari
4 drops Umami Bitters
.
(Method)
Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish: Plum

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thehobbydrinkchef 

Continuing the week with another Negroni riff for your taste buds! 

This time, we’re abandoning the classic template of Italian bitter red in favour of some bitter Bianco! This is also sure to be a hit in the fall or winter months, and subbing in a Cognac for the Pisco, would work just as well 

1oz Pisco 
1oz Pear Infused Lillet
1oz Luxardo Bitter Bianco 

Add all ingredients to a mixing glass with ice and stir. Serve up in a Nick & Nora, or over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with an orange twist

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @tonypescatori & @nightjar 

•
•
🌔 𝓜𝓸𝓸𝓷𝓵𝓲𝓰𝓱𝓽 𝓼𝓸𝓾𝓻 🌟
•
50ml Bulleit Bourbon Whiskey
30ml Grapefruit juice
20ml Mancino Secco Vermouth
1 barspoon of Ciliegia Quaglia Cherry Liqueur
•
Texturiser : albumine or whey protein work well for that froth
•
A drink inspired by a 1930's Moonlight Cocktail From Harry Craddock's Savoy Cocktail Book - swipe left for the classic recipe.
•
I thought to work first around the bitter grapefruit that work as well with gin as with Bourbon - Brown Derby anyone? - then added the wine element, spiced in form of dry vermouth and substituting the dry, straightforward kirsch with a splash of deep, luscious Ciliegia Quaglia.
•
Ciliegia is on top of the list of my favourite liqueurs, its mixability and potency is so high that it has to be used in moderation when adding nuances in a drink not to change the flavour completely!
•
We then create the 🌘moonlight effect 🌘 - to surprise guests and create a connection between name and serve - with an aromatic half moon made of 🦋butterfly pea flower and 🍃makrut lime leaf as well as a 🌟floregano 'star'
•

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @ebbydranks 

Happy Negroni Week! I remember vividly the first one I ever made for myself. It was vile. The vermouth was impressively left out at room temperature for over a year. The bitterness of Campari (which I adore now) was overwhelming af. I don't think I made myself another Negroni for months. But when I did, I knew what I was walking myself into: Heaven. This riff by Naren Young (@forkandshaker) is spectacular, and I'd put it in my top three day drinking cocktails. 

Negroni Frappe 

1 oz gin (@greatwomenspirits)
1 oz Meletti 1870 Bitter (@meletti_official)
1 oz orange juice
3 dashes orange bitters (@scrappysbitters) 

Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker with a few pieces of crushed ice and shake until ice has melted. Strain into a snazzy cocktail glass (@amehla_co) and garnish with an orange peel. 

September is World Alzheimer's Month and there's no better time for @surfsidesips and I to work together with your support to raise money for @alzassociation. The Alzheimer's Association leads the way to end Alzheimer's and all other dementia — by accelerating global research, driving risk reduction and early detection, and maximizing quality care and support. The Alzheimer's Association is also the largest non-profit committed to advancing vital research toward methods of treatment, prevention and, ultimately, a cure.

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @trufflesontherocks 

Ever tried burnt orange before? Place your orange on an open fire until it's black and charded. Let them cool down before juicing them. The juice will be sweet and smoky. A delicious base for a shrub, syrup or drum rolls... for the most delicious Blood and Sand cocktail. 
Blood and Sand
1 oz Talisker 10 scotch
1 oz Cherry Heering liqueur
1 oz Sweet Vermouth 
1 oz Burnt orange juice
2 Dashes orange bitters *optional 
Shake and serve up in a chilled cocktail coupe.

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸@thecocktailsuite 

Like many people I started my hobby of mixology/photography about a year ago when the world had to shut down. At the time I only knew how to drink cocktails. I didn’t know much about cocktail history, theory, technique, etc. And I knew even less about photography. Sure I had taken some photos while on vacation, but if it turned out okay it was by blind, dumb luck. And with drinks, I could tell if I liked a cocktail or not, but I had no idea why. 

So began the journey down many rabbit holes so I could learn about different spirits, how to craft a proper cocktail, how to create and carve clear ice, how to take a proper photograph, and how to edit the photo afterwards. And I was able to make progress thanks to books like Cocktail Codex (@deathandcompany ), courses like Artificial Lighting Academy (@thebiteshot ) and Lightroom Magic (@twolovesstudio ), and conversations with other mixologists and photographers from the IG community who have been very supportive and helpful. And I look forward forward to learning more! 

Here’s a simple riff of an old-fashioned. All I did was add Averna Amaro to the mix for a slight change of pace. 

𝗢𝗹𝗱-𝗙𝗮𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗲𝗱, 𝗚𝗿𝗮𝘇𝗶𝗲 

2 𝘰𝘻 𝘞𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘳 𝘚𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘙𝘦𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘦 𝘉𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘣𝘰𝘯
1/2 𝘰𝘻 𝘈𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘯𝘢 𝘈𝘮𝘢𝘳𝘰
1 𝘵𝘴𝘱 𝘋𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘢𝘳𝘢 𝘎𝘶𝘮 𝘚𝘺𝘳𝘶𝘱
2 𝘥𝘢𝘴𝘩𝘦𝘴 𝘈𝘯𝘨𝘰𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘢 𝘉𝘪𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴
1 𝘥𝘢𝘴𝘩 𝘖𝘳𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦 𝘉𝘪𝘵𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘴
𝘖𝘳𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦 𝘛𝘸𝘪𝘴𝘵 

Method: Add all ingredients except the orange twist to a mixing glass and stir over ice. Strain into a double rocks glass over a large piece of clear ice. Express the oils from the orange peel and add as a garnish. 

Glassware: @richardbrendonstudio 
.
